title: Interstate Transmission Act
content: Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to determine by rule or order which facilities used for the transmission and delivery of electric energy are used in interstate commerce , and which are used for local distribution . Redefines interstate commerce to include, for FPA purposes, consumption of electricity in a foreign country. Repeals the statutory constraints placed upon the disposition of property by a public utility subject to FERC jurisdiction. Requires FERC to permit a transmitting utility to recover all its costs incurred in connection with the transmission services and necessary associated services, including the costs of any enlargement of transmission facilities. Prescribes guidelines for FERC review of rates, charges, terms, and conditions for transmission service, including: (1) voluntary innovative pricing policies, (2) negotiated rates. And (3) recovery of market-based rates for transmission services. Authorizes a transmitting utility to require both its transmission customers and any transmitting utility with which it is interconnected to observe policies or standards adopted by a FERC- approved electric reliability organization as a prerequisite to receiving transmission service. Authorizes FERC encouragement of the formation of regional transmission organizations to enhance transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce.
